content.title: West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Scheme: Death Assistance
content.department: Labour Department, Government of West Bengal
content.beneficiary: Nominee of the registered migrant worker
content.details: West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Scheme: Death Assistance is a social welfare scheme implemented by the West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Board, Labour Department, Government of West Bengal on 25th April, 2023. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to the nominee in case of natural death/accidental death of the registered migrant worker.
benefits: ₹ 50,000/- (Rupees Fifty thousands) only, in case of normal death.
₹ 2,00,000/- (Rupees two Lakhs) only, for accidental death.
eligibility: The applicant must be a resident of West Bengal.
The applicant’s age should be between 18-60 years.
The applicant must be ordinarily a worker who is employed/ likely to be employed in any State/Union Territories other than the state of West Bengal/ Outside India.
The beneficiary should be a nominee i.e., a person nominated by the registered Migrant Worker from his/ her family.
The migrant worker should have lost his/her life due to natural death/accidental death.
exclusions: No claim shall be admissible to the beneficiary if he/she is in receipt of any other financial assistance of similar nature from the Government of West Bengal.
documents_required: Photo (max Size 50 KB, jpg or jpeg file only)
Aadhar card (Upload document both sides in a single page) (max size 150 KB, pdf file only)
First page of bank account particulars (max size 150 KB, pdf file only)

faqs.question: What is the definition of a Migrant Worker?
faqs.answer: Migrant Worker means a person of the age between 18 to 60 years who is, by origin, a resident of West Bengal and employed in a remunerated activity in any State/Union Territories in India other than West Bengal.

faqs.question: Which department is the management authority for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Scheme will be implemented and monitored by the Labour Department through Labour Commissionerate.

faqs.question: What process will be followed by the department for the administration of the Welfare Assistance?
faqs.answer: All Assistant Labour Commissioners are authorised to verify, administer and sanction claims for assistance under this Scheme within their respective jurisdiction on the basis of criteria as decided by the Board.

faqs.question: What measures are in place to prevent misuse of the Welfare Assistance?
faqs.answer: In case of any misrepresentation of facts or furnishing false information by a Migrant Worker, the registration obtained, may subsequently be cancelled by the registering authority with the approval of the Board, without showing any reason and in such case, all his/ her claims under the scheme shall be revoked.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Scheme: Death Assistance is a social welfare scheme implemented by the West Bengal Migrant Workers’ Welfare Board, Labour Department, Government of West Bengal, that provides an one time assistance to the nominee in case of natural death/accidental death of the registered migrant worker.

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: This scheme was launched on 25th April, 2023.

faqs.question: Who are the targeted beneficiaries under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The nominee of the registered migrant worker of the state are the targeted beneficiaries under this scheme.

faqs.question: What kind of assistance can be availed through this scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, ₹ 50,000/- (Rupees Fifty thousand) only, in case of normal death and ₹ 2,00,000/- (Rupees two Lakh) only for accidental death is provided to the beneficiaries.

faqs.question: How can the benefits be availed?
faqs.answer: The applicant needs to apply through KARMASATHI (PARIJAYEE SHRAMIK) app with all the mandatory documents.

faqs.question: Is there any income criteria to be eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no specific income criteria for the applicant to be eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the frequency of the assistance?
faqs.answer: The assistance will be provided one time to the beneficiaries.

faqs.question: Is there any provision of renewal of registration as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Yes, Migrant Worker, registered as beneficiary, will have to renew his/ her registration on yearly basis, through the portal.
